titleInfo.title: Laying granite along Walnut Street and Union Depot, circa 1897

mods.identifier: City of Nashville 1897 Yearbook 060a Walnut Street

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A picture of men at work laying granite along Walnut Street (10th Avenue), sourced from the “Reports of departments of the City of Nashville for the fiscal year ending December 31, 1897.” Includes a view of the Union Depot, which played an important role to advance the Tennessee Centennial Exposition of 1897. The yearbook consists of official reports of the City Government of Nashville, Tennessee, with a Message of the Mayor R.H. Dudley to the City Council members, dated Jan. 13, 1898. This publication was prepared for the press by James T. Bell, Recorder. Forms part of the City of Nashville published reports. 1 yearbook.

titleInfo.title: Publications, City of Nashville reports, 1897 yearbook
